translations.english_saheeh: By the sky and the night comer
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the heaven, and At-Târiq (the night-comer, i.e. the bright star);
translations.english_rwwad: By the sky and the night comer –

translations.english_saheeh: And what can make you know what is the night comer?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And what will make you to know what At-Târiq (night-comer) is?
translations.english_rwwad: and how do you know what the night comer is?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1901]- Whose light pierces through the darkness.

translations.english_hilali_khan: (It is) the star of piercing brightness;
translations.english_rwwad: It is the star of piercing brightness –

arabic_text: إِن كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ لَّمَّا عَلَيۡهَا حَافِظٞ

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.86:4)
a) Whoever intended to do a good deed or a bad deed:.
Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما : The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم narrating about his Lord عز وجل said, "Allâh ordered (the appointed angels over you) that the good and the bad deeds be written, and He then showed (the way) how (to write). If somebody intends to do a good deed and he does not do it, then Allâh will write for him a full good deed (in his account with Him); and if he intends to do a good deed and actually does it, then Allâh will write for him (in his account) with Him (its reward equal) from ten to seven hundred times, to many more times; and if somebody intends to do a bad deed and he does not do it, then Allâh will write a full good deed (in his account) with Him, and if he intends to do it (a bad deed) and actually does it, then Allâh will write one bad deed (in his account)." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.8, Hadith No.498)
b) Narrated Abu Hurairah رضي الله عنه The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "Angels come (to you) in succession by night and day, and all of them get together at the time of the Fajr and ‘Asr prayers. Then those who have stayed with you overnight, ascend unto Allâh, Who asks them (and He knows the answer better than they): "How have you left My slaves?" They reply, "We left them while they were praying and we came to them while they were praying." The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم added: "If anyone of you says Amîn (during the prayer at the end of the recitation of Sûrat Al-Fâtihah ), and the angels in heaven say the same, and the two sayings coincide, all his past sins will be forgiven." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.4, Hadith No. 446).

translations.english_saheeh: There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
translations.english_hilali_khan: There is no human being but has a protector over him (or her) (i.e. angels in charge of each human being guarding him, writing his good and bad deeds)[1]
translations.english_rwwad: there is no soul except that there is a watcher over it.

translations.english_saheeh: So let man observe from what he was created.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So let man see from what he is created!
translations.english_rwwad: Let man reflect on what he was created from.

translations.english_saheeh: He was created from a fluid, ejected,
translations.english_hilali_khan: He is created from a water gushing forth,
translations.english_rwwad: He was created from a spurting fluid,

phonetic: 86.7 Yakhruju Min Bayni Aş-Şulbi Wa At-Tarā'ibi

translations.english_saheeh: Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Proceeding from between the backbone and the ribs.
translations.english_rwwad: emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, He [i.e., Allāh], to return him [to life], is Able.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, (Allâh) is Able to bring him back (to life)!
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, Allah is able to bring him back to life.

translations.english_saheeh: The Day when secrets will be put on trial,[1902]
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day when all the secrets (deeds, prayers, fasting, etc.) will be examined (as to their truth).
translations.english_rwwad: On the Day when all secrets will be disclosed,

arabic_text: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٖ وَلَا نَاصِرٖ
phonetic: 86.10 Famā Lahu Min Qūwatin Wa Lā Nāşirin

translations.english_saheeh: Then he [i.e., man] will have no power or any helper.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he will have no power, nor any helper.
translations.english_rwwad: he will then have no power, nor any helper.

translations.english_saheeh: By the sky which sends back[1903]
translations.english_hilali_khan: By the sky (having rain clouds) which gives rain, again and again.
translations.english_rwwad: By the sky and its recurring rain,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1904]- With plant growth or from geological rifts.

translations.english_hilali_khan: And the earth which splits (with the growth of trees and plants).
translations.english_rwwad: and by the earth that cracks open [with the sprout of plants],

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a decisive statement,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, this (the Qur’ân) is the Word that separates (the truth from falsehood, and commands strict laws for mankind to cut the roots of evil).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a decisive word,

translations.english_hilali_khan: And it is not a thing for amusement.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, they are planning a plan,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, they are but plotting a plot (against you O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, they are devising a plan.

translations.english_saheeh: But I am planning a plan.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And I (too) am planning a plan.
translations.english_rwwad: I am too devising a plan.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1905]- i.e., Do not be in haste for revenge, for you will see what will become of them.

translations.english_saheeh: So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.[1905]
translations.english_hilali_khan: So give a respite to the disbelievers; deal gently with them for a while.
translations.english_rwwad: So bear with the disbelievers, and respite them for a while.
